cat: Titles of national or ethnic leadership

'Shah' (; , , king) is a title given to the kings and lords of Iran and India.
It was continuously used in Persia and Greater Iran. In India, it was used by
Mughal rulers. The word derives from the Old Iranian, Avestan xšaΘra, "power"
and "command",<ref>Old Avestan Gloassary. Prods Oktor Skjærvø. Harvard
University. 2006.</ref> corresponding to Sanskrit (Ancient Indian) kshatriya,
"warrior". The full, Old Persian title of the Achaemenid rulers of the First
Persian Empire was XšāyaΘiya XšāyaΘiyānām, "King of Kings"."<ref>Old Persian.
Appendices, Glossaries, Indices & Transcriptions. Prods Oktor Skjærvø. Harvard
University. 2003.</ref>
wiki.title: shah
